alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 2:51PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Somerset and northern Middlesex Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Middlesex, or near Plainfield, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Carteret, Middlesex, Bound Brook, Manville, Colonia, Dayton, Martinsville, North Brunswick Township, Society Hill, Kendall Park, Woodbridge and South Plainfield. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 10 and 12. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 39 and 42. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 15. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 124 and 134. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
